result.execSummary:
The defendant Holly Marie Meier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Probation modified 10-31-2016 as indicated below:
Probation modified 03-06-2017 as indicated below:

miscConds.notes: Pay costs/surcharges according to a schedule as set forth by Probation & Parole.

timeConds.notes: AMENDED 10-31-2016:  Community service hours to be reported to Probation & Parole.
AMENDED 10-31-2016: Serve 15 days in the Pepin County Jail with work release, no good time, commencing 11-25-2016 at 9:00 a.m.

AMENDED 03-06-2017:  Defendant serve 20 days in the Pepin County Jail commencing 4-15-2017 at 6:00 p.m. unless by that date all court ordered obligations are paid in full.
AMENDED 04-17-2017 - Received verification from Probation & Parole agent that defendant paid court ordered obligations in full.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Holly Marie Meier

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 17R 000619 - Balance owing paid in full from DOC
Correspondence from DOC that defendant paid in full to DOC agent.

Defendant Holly Marie Meier in court.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant nearing discharge with unpaid court ordered obligations.  Defendant plans to pay them Monday out of her tax refund.  Court modifies condition of probation to serve 20 days in the PCJ com. 4/15/17 at 6 p.m. unless by that date all court ordered obligations are paid in full.
Probation review hearing on March 6, 2017 at 02:15 pm.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Court denies request.
Letter faxed from Holly Meier requesting to report after the first of the year.

Defendant Holly Marie Meier in court with attorney Brian H. Wright.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State filed motion to revoke DPA for failure to do community service.  Counsel informs the fact is accurate but Ms. Meier did complete some C/S, not 8 hrs./mo. and her plan to get caught up on C/S.  State leaves consequence up to the Court.  Court discusses options.  State does not object to leave DPA alone but defendant complete C/S.  Court denies motion to revoke DPA, complete C/S and report the hours to Probation & Parole; modify probation in other case and sentence to 15 days jail w/work release com. 11/25 at 9:00 a.m., no good time.
Atty Brian Wright appt'd.
Probation review hearing on October 31, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Holly Marie Meier in court.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State informs he filed Motion to Revoke on velony case.  Court advised defendant of right to attorney.  Defendant wishes to contact an attorney.  Court encourages defendant to contact the PD office.  Probation review hearing scheduled for October 31, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Probation review hearing on October 18, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Buffalo-Pepin Counties CJCC Termination of C/S.  Buffalo-Pepin Counties CJCC Termination of C/S for failure to comply with the program.  The defendant has not completed the assigned community service.

Referred to Buffalo-Pepin Counties Criminal Justice Coordinating Council for completing 80 hours of community service.  Identify the project by 06-17-2016. Complete all hours by 04-01-2017 with minimum of 8 hours per month.   Consequences of termination from the program:  Revoke DPA.

Defendant Holly Marie Meier in court with attorney Roger M. Hillestad.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement reached.  Defendant will plead to count 1 of Information in 15CF33, 2 yr. DAGPA; plea to 15CM49, 1 yr. probation, no jail, with conditions.  Court advises defendant of charge in 15CF33/max. penalties; review agreement.  Court advises defendan tof charge in 15CM49/max penalties.  Subject to the DPA in 15CF33, defendant pleads guilty; to worthless check charge in 15CM49  defendant pleads guilty.  Plea Colloquy. Court finds defendant's waiver of her constitutional rights & plea done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts her plea in 15CM49 and finds her guilty; defers accepts plea in 15CF33 and approves the DPA.  Court withholds sentence in 15CM49 and places defendant on 1 yr. probation with conditions.  Court approves the DPA.  Atty fees approved, paid.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 17, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on April 25, 2016 at 12:45 pm.
Status conference on March 29, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Holly Marie Meier in court with attorney Roger M. Hillestad.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Hillestad just appointed by SPD office, request PH, defendant waives TL.  Court discharged Atty Morgan as County Appt'd Atty.  Referred to scheduling clerk.
Atty Roger Hillestad appt'd.

Defendant Holly Marie Meier in court.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Morgan previously appointed as County Appt'd Atty.  Defendant informs she cannot afford to pay for attorney, contacted the PD office and they will be assigning an attorney for her.  Court confirms Mr. Morgan's withdrawal as County Appt'd Atty.  Status conference scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Letter to Attorney appointed by court advising defendant failed to make payments for November 1 and December 1 towards county appointed attorney fees and terminate your appointment.
Interim Order for Compensation of Court Appointed Attorney
Petition for Payment of County Appointed Attorney Fees
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
Status conference at 01-05-2016 11:00 am
Order Appointing Counsel in 15CF33 extended to this case.

Defendant Holly Marie Meier in court with attorney Allan L Morgan.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Morgan informs the court defendant paid for the check.  Court confirms defendant received copy of criminal complaint, and same rights as in other case.  NGP entered.  Counsel requests matter be set out to Jan.  Court extends County Appt'd Atty to both cases.  Referred to scheduling clerk.
